titleStmt.title: A case of conscience resolved. Wherein it is cleared, that the King may without impeachment to his oath, touching the clergy at coronation, consent to the abrogation of episcopacy. And the objections against it in two learned treatises, printed at Oxford, fully answered. / By John Geree Master of Arts, and preacher of the word of God at St. Albans. Published acording to order.
titleStmt.author: Geree, John, 1601?-1649.

titleStmt.title: A case of conscience resolved. Wherein it is cleared, that the King may without impeachment to his oath, touching the clergy at coronation, consent to the abrogation of episcopacy. And the objections against it in two learned treatises, printed at Oxford, fully answered. / By John Geree Master of Arts, and preacher of the word of God at St. Albans. Published acording to order.
titleStmt.author: Geree, John, 1601?-1649.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Matthew Simmons, for John Bartlet, at the Guilt-Cup at Austines-Gate,

notesStmt.note: A reply to "A review of the Covenant" by Gerald Langbaine, and another, unidentified work.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
